intro: Lactuca hoffmeisteri, commonly known as Hoffmeister's lettuce, is a species of flowering plant in the dandelion family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped, hairy leaves and a tall, branching stem that bears small, yellow flowers. Native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia, this plant thrives in temperate climates. It is often found in grasslands, meadows, and disturbed soils. The plant is not typically cultivated for food but is of interest to botanists and gardeners due to its unique appearance and ecological role.
